item.title: SilkAir expands its route network to include Laos
item.description:
SilkAir, the regional subsidiary of Singapore Airlines, has started its first flights to Vientiane and Luang Prabang in Laos. This addition expands SilkAir’s network to 51 destinations across 14 countries. The inaugural flight left Singapore’s Changi Airport at 1:20 PM on October 31st and arrived at Vientianeâ€™s Wattay International Airport at 3:15 PM. The same flight continued on to Luang Prabang International Airport at 4:05 PM, landing at 5:00 PM. The return flight from Luang Prabang departed at 5:50 PM and arrived back in Singapore at 10:05 PM (all times local)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/silkair-expands-its-route-network-to-include-laos/

item.title: IMF provides feedback on the economy of Laos
item.description:
At the end of January, the Executive Board of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) concluded its annual Article IV consultation with the Lao People’s Democratic Republic. The IMF reported that real GDP growth is anticipated to decrease from 7.5% in 2015 to 7% in 2016. This moderation is attributed to a less favorable external environment leading to slower domestic activity, and a reduction in credit growth from its previous high levels...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/imf-provides-feedback-on-the-economy-of-laos/
